medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 4.5 months prior to admission, when fevers, malaise, mild cough, and left flank pain developed. Symptoms worsened over time, with increased fever and cough. Two days before admission, he experienced early satiety, nausea, nonbloody diarrhea, orthopnea, leg edema, abdominal distention, decreased urine output, and weight gain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital aortic stenosis due to a subaortic membrane, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, atrial fibrillation, complete heart block, ascending aortic aneurysm with severe aortic insufficiency, diverticulosis, gout; previous surgeries include subaortic membrane resection at age 10, open revision surgery with aortic-valve repair and septal myomectomy at age 50, pacemaker placement at age 52, and pulmonary-vein isolation at age 58.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had congestive heart failure, father had peripheral vascular disease, nephew had thoracic aortic aneurysm, brother died from a ruptured thoracic aortic aneurysm.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with wife in suburban New England, recently retired from IT, traveled to California, Europe, and southeastern US; former smoker (20-pack-year history, quit 9 years ago), drinks alcohol socially, never used illicit drugs.
